post.description: A user (or end user) is a consumer of Zatar that either has an active account or is in the process of setting one up. A user can be created, retrieved, and updated.

parameters.name: User Profile Object
parameters.description: A User object to be added to Zatar

201.description: The new resource was created. Payload contains newly created user.

get.description: Retrieve the meta-data associated with your user profile.

put.summary: Change the profile data in your account.
put.description: Change the profile data in your account.

parameters.name: User Profile Object
parameters.description: A User object to be added to Zatar

get.description: Retrieve the meta-data associated with your user profile.

post.description: Create a new authentication token by doing an HTTP POST.

201.description: The new resource was created. Payload contains newly created user.

get.summary: Verify that a token is valid (not expired)
get.description: Verify that a token is valid (not expired).

get.summary: Verify a password reset token is still valid and has not expired
get.description: Verify a password reset token is still valid and has not expired

get.summary: Verify the invtation is still valid and has not expired
get.description: Verify the invtation is still valid and has not expired

Retrieve a collection of avatardefinitions with an HTTP GET.This would retrieve all the publicly available avatar definitions and the avatar definitions from all the worlds that the user has read permissions on.
Retrieve a specific avatar definition with an HTTP GET. The user only has access to public avatar definitions and the avatar definitions belonging to worlds that the user has read permissions on.

delete.description: Deletes a specific avatar definition with an HTTP GET. The user only has access to public avatar definitions and the avatar definitions belonging to worlds that the user has read permissions on.

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of avatar definition firmware
get.description: All existing firmwares for an avatar definition Id can be retrieved by performing an HTTP GET.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific avatar definition firmware
get.description: Specific firmware versions associated with an avatar definition Id can be retrieved by performing an HTTP GET.
Retrieve a collection of worlds via HTTP GET

put.summary: Change some of the resources the world can contain
put.description: Currently only name of the world can be changed. Invite a user to join a world does not use PUT. Transferring ownership of a world is currently not supported. The creator of the world remains the only owner.

get.description: Retrieves a world resource and its associated resources.

post.description: Create a new device avatar by registering a source and automatically pairing it to an avatar definition with an HTTP POST

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of avatars in specific world
get.description: Retrieve a collection of avatars from a user's account private world by performing an HTTP GET.

put.summary: Change properties or send commands to an avatar
put.description: Some of the properties of an avatar can be changed using PUT. Sending commands is also possible doing a PUT

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatar_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the avatar being updated.

get.summary: Retrieve an avatar for a single device
get.description: Retrieve an avatar for a single device by performing an HTTP GETand including the avatarId.

delete.description: Permanently delete a device avatar and remove it from the database by performing an HTTP DELETE and including the avatar_id

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatar_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the avatar being updated.

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of jobs of an avatar
get.description: Retrieves all the non expired jobs associated with an avatar by performing an HTTP GET.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific jobs of an avatar
get.description: Retrieves a specific non expired job associated with an avatar by performing an HTTP GET.

get.summary: Retrieve history of an avatar for a single device
get.description: Retrieve the history of an avatar for a single device by performing an HTTP GET and including the avatar_id.

post.description: Creates an avatar group (static or dynamic based on the content of the payload) with an HTTP POST

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

get.summary: Retrieve a collection of avatar groups
get.description: Retrieve a collection of avatar groups via a HTTP GET

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

put.summary: Change the name of a group
put.description: Change the name of a group with an HTTP PUT

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Avatar group with an HTTP PUT

parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

delete.description: Delete a specific Avatar group with an HTTP DELETE

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

post.summary: Adds an avatar to an avatar group
post.description: Adds an avatar to an avatar group by performing an HTTP POST.

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the intended avatar group to contain the avatar.

get.summary: Retrieve all the Avatars associated with an Avatar group
get.description: Retrieve all the avatars associated with an Avatar Group with an HTTP GET.

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the intended avatar group to contain the avatar.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Filters result to only show requested properties as well as avatarDefinitionId, homeWorld, href, sysPrefix.

delete.summary: Delete an Avatar from a group
delete.description: Deletes a device permanently from a group by performing an HTTP DELETE

parameters.name: world_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatargroup_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

parameters.name: avatar_id
parameters.description: The resource ID of the world containing the avatar.

first_name.description: First name of the Zatar user. Support for alphabet characters only (a-z)(A-Z), support for special character space [ ], maximum 64 characters.

last_name.description: Last name of the Zatar user. Support for alphabet characters only (a-z)(A-Z), support for special character apostrophe', support for special character dash-, support for special character space [ ], maximum 64 characters.

email.description: Email address of the Zatar user. Must meet minimum email format requirements according to RFC

cellPhoneNumber.description: Support for numeric characters (0-9), support for additional phone number special characters, format: +country code - area code - phone number.

password.description: alphanumeric string (a-z, 0-9), case sensitive, must contain one upper case letter, must contain one lower case letter, must contain one number, must contain one special character (@#$%^&+), minimum 8 characters, maximum 16 characters

email.description: Email address of the Zatar user. Must meet minimum email format requirements according to RFC

password.description: alphanumeric string (a-z, 0-9), case sensitive, must contain one upper case letter, must contain one lower case letter, must contain one number, must contain one special character (@#$%^&+), minimum 8 characters, maximum 16 characters

email.description: Email address of the Zatar user you wish to invite to a world.

world.description: The URI of the world you are inviting the user to join.

email.description: Your registered Zatar email address which we will use to send you a password reset link.

name.description: The name of your Avatar Definition.
alphanumeric string (a-z, 0-9), characters -, _, and . supported, not case sensitive, must be between 8-64 characters long, cannot contain two periods next to each other

dt.description: Data Type: possible values are STRING.

perm.description: Permission: 0 = Client application cannot upate, 1 = ??, 2 = Client application updates trigger an update to be sent to Avatar's device.

uom.description: Unit of Measurement: Reserved for future use

stpk.description: NEED NAME: The key of the key/value pair representing this attribute in the code of the device driver running on this Avatar's physical device.

data.description: Data: The value of this attribute.

avatarDefinitionId.description: The URI of the Avatar Definition you wish to use to make this Avatar from.

attributes.description: The JSON object providing the initial attribute values of this Avatar. The only required attribute is the device's UDI.
